alternatives.transcript: top Executives from the major cigarette companies mounted their assault on Capitol Hill yesterday seven tobacco CEOs answered major charges by Congress about the dangers of smoking and the hazards of nicotine the cry to regulate tobacco is being heard louder and clearer than ever before in Washington but tobacco Executives relentlessly hammered back at their critics

would you rather board a plane with a pilot who just smoked a cigarette or one with a pilot who just had a couple of beers or snorted cocaine or shot heroin or pop some pills under a barrage of questions the tobacco Executives repeatedly said that they are not convinced that smoking causes death

things got hot and heavy Thursday to hearing of the house Energy and Commerce subcommittee on health and the environment the Witnesses were seven Tobacco Company Executives responding to charges of manipulating nicotine levels in their cigarettes to cause Addiction in smokers some of the congressmen were hostile

and I just can't understand how each of you is engaged in an Enterprise that is sure to kill some of our children but as they say Executives gave as good as they got any member of this subcommittee truly believes that cigarettes are too dangerous to be sold then stand up vote for prohibition and be prepared for the consequences

that was James Johnston chairman and CEO of RJR Reynolds one of the world's largest tobacco companies and this morning he is at our NBC affiliate in Winston-Salem North Carolina WXII TV mr. Johnston good morning good morning Matt we just saw segment of the hearings yesterday in which you talked about Prohibition the Banning of the sale of cigarettes in this country I'm sure that's not something you like to think about a lot but what were you talking about when you talked about the consequences of that action I was talking about what what happens when you raise

raise taxes too much when you ban a product people find other ways to obtain that product will shut our doors will go home we'll go find new jobs and then people will get cigarettes because some will continue to smoke no matter what and they will get them from people who sell them out of the trunks of cars who don't care what they sell and don't care who they sell them to let's be honest though very few people are actually talking about banning cigarettes very few people in government but a

lot of people are talking mr. Johnston about the possible regulation of the tobacco industry by the FDA just as the FDA regulates other drugs why shouldn't cigarettes be regulated as a drug or nicotine

Matt we are talking about Prohibition and whether it comes through the front door or sneaks in through the back door it's the same Congressman sign our who wants FDA regulation has said this he's quartered in the National Journal as saying FDA regulation will be the end of this industry and then yesterday in the hearing he said well all we want to do is have the FDA approved are safe but of course we don't think they're safe isn't that prohibition well do you think being dishonest

just about what he's written his real intention is mr. Johnson do you really think that FDA regulation would be the end of the tobacco industry that's what Congressman sign are so do you think it would I don't know sir a lot of people obviously are complaining and have charged as you well know that cigarette companies like your own manipulate the level of nicotine in a cigarette to addicts smokers do you still maintain that the only reason nicotine is in a cigarette is for Taste man

is a natural part of tobacco anyone who spoke people have known about nicotine in cigarettes for 100 years this is not some new surprise what we made very clear to the committee yesterday is these false allegations that we somehow Spike our products are clearly untrue I said in sworn testimony Matt we do not Spy Car cigarettes we do not maintain nicotine in our cigarettes to to
take people so why not take it out of cigarettes all together

because people don't like the taste a competitor of ours spent three hundred million dollars to develop and market a virtually nicotine-free cigarette and smokers didn't like it think about it this way Matt when you get a Coca-Cola out of the refrigerator and you forgot to screw the cap back on it it's still Coca-Cola but it doesn't taste right if nicotine were the only thing that people wanted met that the nicotine patches

nicotine gum would work many people return to cigarettes because there's a ritual to it it's part of your life you have a cup of coffee have a cigarette there is something and lots more part of your life that a lot of people consider a habitual part of their life it is a habit yes indeed do you smoke mr. Johnston yes I do do you consider it a habit yes I do so then would you say you're addicted to cigarettes no no more than I would say I'm addicted to chocolate

or or coffee I get cranky in the morning if I don't have my coffee if I'm deprived of coffee I feel some withdrawal but to compare it as some of these men did to cocaine and heroin is ridiculous if I were getting on an airplane Matt and I find that the pilot had just had a cigarette or had shot heroin or had snorted cocaine I'll take the pilot who's just smoked a cigarette butt to some but to say that it's

Not Like Cocaine because it doesn't affect your ability to function is not saying that it doesn't affect your ability to stop ask any law enforcement agent in this country and they will tell you cigarettes are not our problem 43 million Americans man have quit smoking almost all of them without any outside help whatsoever have have users of addictive substances had that problem too

trivialize that word in that way in a country that has an increasing drug problem starts to really confuse people mr. Johnson let me let me cut into 16 I have about 10 seconds left a good litmus test is to look at children do you have children yes sir I do do you want them to smoke I do not want my children to smoke until their legal age I do not want your children or anyone elses and we have a proven track record as a company of supporting that we have
we've paid for a program that's in 10,000 schools that speaks to 3 million of students telling him do not smoke mr. Johnston we appreciate you being with us this morning thank you so much

the United States Congress is on a never never ending march to take slowly and surely step-by-step your freedoms away latest their tactics on the tobacco companies Henry Waxman Democrat Congressman California brought a bunch of tobacco CEOs up and told him what a bunch of rotten guys they were James Johnson from RJ Reynolds refused to sit for it here's what he said

my company and I take very seriously the allegations that have been leveled against us and I would like the record to clearly show that Reynolds tobacco does not Spike its products with nicotine in fact our process results in the loss of nicotine

we do not add or otherwise manipulate nicotine to addicts smokers let's apply some multi cultural liberalism to this why are we down on smokers didn't Native Americans the most wonderful people that ever lived Indians didn't they smoke smoke these pipes and where's the ACLU defending smokers as a minority I mean smokers are at Ruben RT now real problem here is a step-by-step encroachment folks one of these do some studies and if this tobacco

kills you secondarily or or primarily ban it but don't go through the motion of we're going to ban it on airplanes are going to ban it on Long airplane flights are going to ban on international flights are going to ban in restaurants you're gonna ban in public buildings we're going to ban it your backyard we're going to ban in your house we're going to ban it your bedroom we're going to ban it in your bathroom you can't do it alright that's just a slow but sure encroach with your freedoms

and you go along with it because it's happening so slowly it's not just in tobacco it's happening with health care and everything else you're going to have to pay attention to this because this is not the right way to go about this kind of thing once you liberals telling you what's good for you what you shouldn't do should do what you can and can't do because of what's good and bad for you only they know back with our final segment after this
